original: Majjhima Nikāya 100
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Saṅgāravasutta
analyzed: saṅgāravasutta
translated: With Saṅgārava

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ carati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam carati mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhi
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was wandering in the Kosalan country with a large Sangha of bhikkhus,🔽and eventually he arrived at a Kosalan town named Saṃkassa.

original: Tena kho pana samayena dhanañjānī nāma brāhmaṇī cañcalikappe paṭivasati abhippasannā buddhe ca dhamme ca saṅghe ca.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena dhanañjānī nāma brāhmaṇī cañcalikappe paṭivasati abhippasannā buddhe ca dhamme ca saṅghe ca
translated: Now on that occasion a brahmin lady named Dhananjani was living in Saṃkassa. She was devoted to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha,

original: Atha kho dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī upakkhalitvā tikkhattuṁ udānaṁ udānesi:🔽“Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: atha kho dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī upakkhalitvā tikkhattum udānam udānesi  namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: and after stumbling, she uttered this exclamation:🔽“Honour to the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened!

original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Honour to the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened!

original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassā”ti.🔽Tena kho pana samayena saṅgāravo nāma māṇavo cañcalikappe paṭivasati tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ🔽pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ sākkharappabhedānaṁ itihāsapañcamānaṁ, padako, veyyākaraṇo,
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ati  tena kho pana samayena saṅgāravaḥ nāma māṇavaḥ cañcalikappe paṭivasati tiṇṇam vedāna  pāragū itihāsa pañcamāna padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ
translated: Honour to the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened!”

original: lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo.
analyzed: lokāyata mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu anavayaḥ
translated: Now on that occasion a brahmin student named Saṅgārava was living in Saṃkassa. He was a master of the Three Vedas with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and etymology, and the histories as a fifth; skilled in philology and grammar, he was fully versed in natural philosophy and in the marks of a Great Man.

original: Assosi kho saṅgāravo māṇavo dhanañjāniyā brāhmaṇiyā evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsamānāya.
analyzed: assosi kho saṅgāravaḥ māṇavaḥ dhanañjāniyā brāhmaṇiyā evam vācam bhāsamānāya
translated: Saṅgārava heard the brahmin Dhananjani speaking in this way.

original: Sutvā dhanañjāniṁ brāhmaṇiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sutvā dhanañjānim brāhmaṇim etat avoca
translated: Having heard it, he said to the brahmin Dhananjani:

original: “avabhūtāva ayaṁ dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī, parabhūtāva ayaṁ dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī, vijjamānānaṁ tevijjānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ, atha ca pana tassa muṇḍakassa samaṇakassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsissatī”ti.
analyzed: avabhūtā ava ayam dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī parabhūtā ava ayam dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī vijjamānānam tevijjānam brāhmaṇāna atha ca pana tassa muṇḍakassa samaṇakassa vaṇṇam bhāsissati iti
translated: “The brahmin Dhananjani is possessed, overcome with lust for the ascetic Gotama.

original: “Na hi pana tvaṁ, tāta bhadramukha, tassa bhagavato sīlapaññāṇaṁ jānāsi.
analyzed: na hi pana tva tāta bhadra mukha tassa bhagavato sīla paññāṇam jānāsi
translated: “But, dear Bhadramukha, you don’t know the ascetic Gotama’s virtue and wisdom.

original: Sace tvaṁ, tāta bhadramukha, tassa bhagavato sīlapaññāṇaṁ jāneyyāsi, na tvaṁ, tāta bhadramukha, taṁ bhagavantaṁ akkositabbaṁ paribhāsitabbaṁ maññeyyāsī”ti.
analyzed: sace tva tāta bhadra mukha tassa bhagavato sīla paññāṇam jāneyyāsi na tva tāta bhadra mukha tam bhagavantam akkositabbam paribhāsitabbam maññeyyāsi iti
translated: If you did know them, dear Bhadramukha, you wouldn’t think of reviling and abusing him.”

original: “Tena hi, bhoti, yadā samaṇo gotamo cañcalikappaṁ anuppatto hoti atha me āroceyyāsī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bhoti yadā samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ cañcali kappam anuppattaḥ hoti atha me āroceyyāsi iti
translated: “Then, when the ascetic Gotama has arrived in Cañcala, tell me.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhadramukhā”ti kho dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī saṅgāravassa māṇavassa paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhadra mukhā ati kho dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī saṅgāravassa māṇavassa paccassosi
translated: “Yes, dear,” she replied.

original: Atha kho bhagavā kosalesu anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena cañcalikappaṁ tadavasari.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā kosalesu anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena cañcalikappam tat avasari
translated: Then the Blessed One, wandering by stages in the Kosalan country, arrived at Cañcalikappa.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā cañcalikappe viharati todeyyānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ ambavane.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā cañcalikappe viharati todeyyānam brāhmaṇānam ambavane
translated: There at Cañcalikappa he stayed in the mango grove belonging to the brahmin Todeyya.🔽The brahmin lady Dhananjani heard that,

original: Assosi kho dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī: “bhagavā kira cañcalikappaṁ anuppatto, cañcalikappe viharati todeyyānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ ambavane”ti.
analyzed: assosi kho dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī bhagavā kira cañcalikappam an uppattaḥ cañcalikappe viharati todeyyānam brāhmaṇānam ambavane iti
translated: “The Blessed One, they say, has arrived at Cañcalikappa and is staying in the mango grove belonging to the brahmin Todeyya.”

original: Atha kho dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī yena saṅgāravo māṇavo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā saṅgāravaṁ māṇavaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu dhanañjānī brāhmaṇī yena saṅgāravaḥ māṇavaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā saṅgāravam māṇavam etat avoca
translated: Then the brahmin lady Dhananjani went to the brahmin student Sangarava and said to him:

original: “ayaṁ, tāta bhadramukha, so bhagavā cañcalikappaṁ anuppatto, cañcalikappe viharati todeyyānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ ambavane.
analyzed: tāta bhadra mukha saḥ bhagavā cañcalikappam anuppattaḥ cañcalikappe viharati todeyyānam brāhmaṇānam ambavane
translated: “Dear sir, the Blessed One has arrived at Cañcalikappa and is staying in the mango grove belonging to the brahmin Todeyya.

original: Yassadāni, tāta bhadramukha, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni tāta bhadra mukha kālam maññasi iti
translated: Now is the time for you to do as you think fit.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho saṅgāravo māṇavo dhanañjāniyā brāhmaṇiyā paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho saṅgāravaḥ māṇavaḥ dhanañjāniyā brāhmaṇiyā paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Saṅgārava replied. He went to the Buddha, exchanged pleasantries with him,

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho saṅgāravo māṇavo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saṅgāravaḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and then sat down. He told the Buddha all he had discussed with Dhanañjānī, adding:

original: “Santi kho, bho gotama, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā diṭṭhadhammābhiññāvosānapāramippattā, ādibrahmacariyaṁ paṭijānanti.
analyzed: santi kho bho gotama eke samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ diṭṭhadhamma abhiññā vosāna pārami pattāḥ ādi brahmacariyam paṭijānanti
translated: “Sir, there are some ascetics and brahmins who claim to be fully enlightened and to teach the Dhamma for ending the effluents.

original: Tatra, bho gotama, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā diṭṭhadhammābhiññāvosānapāramippattā, ādibrahmacariyaṁ paṭijānanti, tesaṁ bhavaṁ gotamo katamo”ti?
analyzed: tatra bho gotama ye te samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ diṭṭhadhamma abhiññā vosāna pārami pattāḥ ādi brahmacariyam paṭijānanti tesam bhavam gotamaḥ katamaḥ iti
translated: Where do they stand in relation to those who claim to be fully enlightened and to teach the Dhamma for ending the effluents?”

original: “Diṭṭhadhammābhiññāvosānapāramippattānaṁ, ādibrahmacariyaṁ paṭijānantānampi kho ahaṁ, bhāradvāja, vemattaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma abhiññā vosāna pārami ppattānaḥ ādi brahmacariyam paṭijānantānam api kho aha bhāradvāja vemattam vadāmi
translated: “Bhāradvāja, I say that even those who claim to be fully enlightened and to teach the Dhamma for ending the effluents are still subject to perplexity, doubt, and uncertainty.

original: Santi, bhāradvāja, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā anussavikā.
analyzed: santi bhāradvāja eke samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: Bhāradvāja, there are some ascetics and brahmins who are traditionalists.

original: Te anussavena diṭṭhadhammābhiññāvosānapāramippattā, ādibrahmacariyaṁ paṭijānanti;
analyzed: te anussavena diṭṭhadhamma abhiññā vosāna pārami pattāḥ ādi brahmacariyam paṭijānanti
translated: They claim to have reached the consummation and perfection of direct knowledge here and now, and to have attained the ultimate end of the holy life for which sons of good family rightly go forth from home to homelessness.

original: seyyathāpi brāhmaṇā tevijjā.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api brāhmaṇā tevijjā
translated: They are like the brahmins of the Three Vedas.

original: Santi pana, bhāradvāja, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kevalaṁ saddhāmattakena diṭṭhadhammābhiññāvosānapāramippattā, ādibrahmacariyaṁ paṭijānanti;
analyzed: santi pana bhāradvāja eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā kevalam saddhāmattakena diṭṭhadhamma abhiññā vosāna pārami pattāḥ ādi brahmacariyam paṭijānanti
translated: “There are some ascetics and brahmins who claim to have reached the consummation and perfection of direct knowledge here and now, and to have attained the ultimate end of the holy life for which sons of good family rightly go forth from home to homelessness, by mere faith alone.

original: seyyathāpi takkī vīmaṁsī.🔽Santi, bhāradvāja, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu sāmaṁyeva dhammaṁ abhiññāya diṭṭhadhammābhiññāvosānapāramippattā, ādibrahmacariyaṁ paṭijānanti.🔽Tatra, bhāradvāja, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu sāmaṁyeva dhammaṁ abhiññāya diṭṭhadhammābhiññāvosānapāramippattā, ādibrahmacariyaṁ paṭijānanti, tesāhamasmi.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api takkī  santi bhāradvāja eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu sāmayā iva dhammam abhiññāya diṭṭhadhamma abhiññā vosāna pārami ppattāḥ ādi brahmacariyam paṭijānanti  tatra bhāradvāja ye te samaṇa brāhmaṇā pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu sāmayā iva dhammam abhiññāya diṭṭhadhamma abhiññā vosāna pārami ppattāḥ ādi brahmacariyam paṭijānanti tesa aham asmi
translated: They are like the rationalists and investigators.🔽“There are some ascetics and brahmins who claim to have reached the consummation and perfection of direct knowledge here and now, and to have attained the ultimate end of the holy life for which sons of good family rightly go forth from home to homelessness, by discovering a path to enlightenment that is new, that has not been discovered before.🔽I am one of those.

original: Tadamināpetaṁ, bhāradvāja, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ, yathā ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbe
analyzed: bhāradvāja pariyāyena veditabba yathā ye te samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ pubbe
translated: “In this way, Bharadvaja, it may be known how there are ascetics and brahmins who claim to have reached the consummation and perfection of direct knowledge here and now, and to have attained the ultimate end of the holy life for which sons of good family rightly go forth from home to homelessness, by discovering a path to enlightenment that is new, that has not been discovered before.

original: ananussutesu dhammesu sāmaṁyeva dhammaṁ abhiññāya diṭṭhadhammābhiññāvosānapāramippattā,
analyzed: an anussutesu dhammesu sāmayā iva dhammam abhiññāya diṭṭhadhamma abhiññā vosāna pārami pattā
translated: I have known for myself, directly, and have attained the ending of birth and death, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming back to any state of being.

original: ādibrahmacariyaṁ paṭijānanti, tesāhamasmi.
analyzed: ādi brahmacariyam paṭijānanti tesāham asmi
translated: I declare this to be the first case.

original: Idha me, bhāradvāja, pubbeva sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattasseva sato etadahosi:
analyzed: idha me bhāradvāja pubbā iva sambodhā an abhisambuddhassa bodhisattassa iva sataḥ etat ahosi
translated: Before my enlightenment, while I was still only an unenlightened Bodhisatta, I thought:

original: ‘sambādho gharāvāso rajāpatho, abbhokāso pabbajjā.
analyzed: sambādhaḥ gharāvāsaḥ rajāpathaḥ abbhokāsaḥ pabbajjā
translated: ‘Household life is crowded and dusty; life gone forth is wide open.

original: Nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: It is not easy, while living in a home, to lead the holy life utterly perfect and pure as a polished shell.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan’ti.🔽So kho ahaṁ, bhāradvāja, aparena samayena daharova samāno susukāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti  saḥ kho aha bhāradvāja aparena samayena daharaḥ uva samānaḥ su su kāḷa kesaḥ bhadrena yobbanena
translated: Suppose I shave off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and go forth from the home life into homelessness.’

original: samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā akāmakānaṁ mātāpitūnaṁ assumukhānaṁ rudantānaṁ kesamassuṁ
analyzed: samannāgataḥ paṭhamena vayasā akāmakānam mātā pitūnam assu mukhānam rudantānam kesa massu
translated: Then, Bharadvaja, after some time had passed, when I was still young, a black-haired young man endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, though my mother and father wished otherwise and wept with tearful faces, I shaved off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and went forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajiṁ.
analyzed: ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbaji
translated: I shaved off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and went forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno kiṅkusalagavesī anuttaraṁ santivarapadaṁ pariyesamāno yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: saḥ evam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ kiṅkusala gavesī anuttaram santivara padam pariyesamānaḥ yena āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca
translated: Searching for what is wholesome, seeking the supreme state of sublime peace, I went to Āḷāra Kālāma and said to him:

original: ‘icchāmahaṁ, āvuso kālāma, imasmiṁ dhammavinaye brahmacariyaṁ caritun’ti.
analyzed: icchāmahe āvuso kālāma imasmin dhamma vinaye brahmacariyam caritun ti
translated: ‘Friend Kālāma, I want to lead the holy life in this Dhamma and Discipline.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhāradvāja, āḷāro kālāmo maṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bhāradvājaḥ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ mam etat avoca
translated: When I had spoken, he replied:

original: ‘viharatāyasmā.
analyzed: viharata ayasmai
translated: ‘Live here, venerable sir.

original: Tādiso ayaṁ dhammo yattha viññū puriso nacirasseva sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyā’ti.
analyzed: tādisaḥ ayam dhammaḥ yattha viññū purisaḥ nacirassa iva sakam ācariyakam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyya ati
translated: This Dhamma is such that a wise man can soon enter upon and abide in it, realising for himself through direct knowledge his own teacher’s doctrine.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, bhāradvāja, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ pariyāpuṇiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha bhāradvāja nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam pariyāpuṇi
translated: So, Bharadvaja, before long I soon learned that Dhamma.

original: So kho ahaṁ, bhāradvāja, tāvatakeneva oṭṭhapahatamattena lapitalāpanamattena ‘ñāṇavādañca vadāmi, theravādañca jānāmi, passāmī’ti ca paṭijānāmi, ahañceva aññe ca.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha bhāradvāja tāvatakena iva oṭṭha pahata mattena lapita lāpana mattena ñāṇa vādañca vadāmi thera vādañca jānāmi passāmi iti ca paṭijānāmi aham ca iva aññe ca
translated: And so, Bhāradvāja, I claimed to know and see, and I claimed to have attained and experienced this for myself, simply on the basis of what I had heard from others.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhāradvāja, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha bhāradvājaḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘na kho āḷāro kālāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ kevalaṁ saddhāmattakena sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedeti;
analyzed: na kho āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ imam dhammam kevalam saddhāmattakena sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti paveda iti
translated: ‘Āḷāra Kālāma does not declare that he has realized this Dhamma for himself by direct knowledge;

original: addhā āḷāro kālāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ jānaṁ passaṁ viharatī’ti.
analyzed: addhā āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ imam dhammam jānam passam viharati iti
translated: surely he knows and sees this Dhamma.’

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhāradvāja, yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: atha khvā āha bhāradvāja yena āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca
translated: So I went to Āḷāra Kālāma and asked him:

original: ‘kittāvatā no, āvuso kālāma, imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedesī’ti?🔽Evaṁ vutte, bhāradvāja, āḷāro kālāmo ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ pavedesi.
analyzed: kittāvatā no āvuso kālāme imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti pavedesi iti  evam vutte bhāradvājaḥ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ ākiñcaññāyatanam pavedesi
translated: ‘Friend Kālāma, in what way do you declare that you have realized this Dhamma for yourself by direct knowledge and enter it and dwell in it?’🔽When this was said, Bhāradvāja, Āḷāra Kālāma declared the base of nothingness.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhāradvāja, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha bhāradvājaḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi saddhā, mayhampatthi saddhā;🔽na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi vīriyaṁ …pe…
analyzed: na kho āḷārassa iva kālāmassa atthi saddhā mayham patthi saddhā  na kho āḷārassa iva kālāmassa atthi vīriyam pe
translated: ‘Āḷāra Kālāma is not the only one who has faith, I have faith too.

original: sati …
analyzed: sati
translated: He is not the only one who has energy, concentration,

original: samādhi …
analyzed: samādhi
translated: mindfulness,

original: paññā, mayhampatthi paññā.
analyzed: paññā mayham patthi paññā
translated: wisdom, I have wisdom too.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ yaṁ dhammaṁ āḷāro kālāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedeti tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyan’ti.🔽So kho ahaṁ, bhāradvāja, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham yam dhammaṃ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti paveda iti tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyanti  saḥ kho aha bhāradvāja nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: Why don’t I strive to realize that state which Āḷāra Kālāma declares he has realized by his knowledge and conduct?’🔽And, Bhāradvāja, in no long time—fast, actually swift—I entered and remained in that state which Āḷāra Kālāma declared he had realized by his knowledge and conduct.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhāradvāja, yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavocaṁ:🔽‘ettāvatā no, āvuso kālāma, imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesī’ti?
analyzed: atha khvā āha bhāradvāja yena āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca  ettāvatā no āvuso kālāma imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi iti

translated: ‘It is this state, friend, that I declare I have realized by my knowledge and conduct.’

translated: ‘I too, friend, have attained this Dhamma directly and dwell having contacted it with the body.’

original: ‘Lābhā no, āvuso, suladdhaṁ no, āvuso,

analyzed: ye mayam āyasmantam tādisam sabrahmacārim passāma  iti yā aham dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi tam tvam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi
translated: that we see a companion in the holy life like this.🔽So I declare this Dhamma having attained it directly, and you declare this Dhamma having attained it directly.

original: yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi tamahaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi.
analyzed: yam tvam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi tam aham dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi
translated: So I declare this Dhamma having attained it directly, and you declare this Dhamma having attained it directly.

original: Iti yāhaṁ dhammaṁ jānāmi taṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi, yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi tamahaṁ dhammaṁ jānāmi.

translated: So I know this Dhamma, and you know this Dhamma.

translated: ‘This Dhamma does not lead to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbāna, but only to reappearance in the base of nothingness.’

translated: Disenchanted with that Dhamma, I left.

translated: Searching for what is wholesome, seeking the supreme state of sublime peace, I went to Uddaka Rāmaputta and said to him:

translated: ‘Please stay, Venerable.

translated: This is a teaching and training such that a wise person can soon realise for themselves by direct knowledge what is now being said by me.’

translated: But I have not yet penetrated it by truly seeing it with wisdom.🔽I have not yet attained it, nor have I seen it, nor have I experienced it for myself.🔽I have not yet reached it, nor do I live in accordance with it.’

original: ‘na kho rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ kevalaṁ saddhāmattakena sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedesi;

translated: I thought: ‘Rāma did not declare that he had attained this teaching just by faith alone.

original: addhā rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ jānaṁ passaṁ vihāsī’ti.

translated: Surely Rāma knew and saw this teaching.’

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhāradvāja, yena udako rāmaputto tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā udakaṁ rāmaputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:

translated: So, Bhāradvāja, in no long time I soon attained that Dhamma by realising it for myself with direct knowledge.

translated: Then I went to Udaka Rāmaputta and said:🔽‘Is the Dhamma realised by you, Rāma, the Dhamma that you claim to have attained by realising it for yourself with direct knowledge, that Dhamma is not fully explained by you?’

translated: ‘It’s a great gain for us, friend, it’s a great blessing for us,

translated: that we see a fellow monastic like you.🔽So the Dhamma that Rāma has attained, reached, and experienced in various ways, you have attained, reached, and experienced in various ways.

original: yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi taṁ dhammaṁ rāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi.

translated: So you know the Dhamma that Rāma knew, and Rāma knew the Dhamma that you know.

translated: I eventually arrived at Uruvelā, at Senānigama.

translated: Then, Bharadvaja, three similes came to me that I had not heard before.

translated: Suppose there were a wet sappy piece of wood lying in water,

translated: Would that man be able to light a fire and produce heat by rubbing the upper fire-stick in the wet sappy wood lying in the water?”

translated: Because the wet sappy wood is soddened with water,

original: Seyyathāpi, bhāradvāja, balavā puriso dubbalataraṁ purisaṁ sīse vā gahetvā khandhe vā gahetvā abhiniggaṇheyya abhinippīḷeyya abhisantāpeyya;🔽evameva kho me, bhāradvāja, dantebhidantamādhāya, jivhāya tāluṁ āhacca, cetasā cittaṁ abhiniggaṇhato abhinippīḷayato abhisantāpayato kacchehi sedā muccanti.

translated: Just as if a strong man were to crush the head of a weak man with his hands,🔽so too, while I was crushing my teeth with my upper teeth and pressing my tongue against the palate, restraining and suppressing both my head and my thoughts, sweat poured from my armpits.

analyzed: na kho pana aham imāya kaṭukāya dukkara kārikāya adhigacchāmi uttari manussa dhammā alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesa
translated: But I did not attain any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones by this practice of austerities.

original: Siyā nu kho añño maggo bodhāyā’ti?
analyzed: siyā nu kho aññaḥ maggaḥ bodhāya ati
translated: Could there be another path to enlightenment?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhāradvāja, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha bhāradvājaḥ
translated: Then, Bhāradvāja, I thought:

original: ‘abhijānāmi kho panāhaṁ pitu sakkassa kammante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinno vivicceva🔽kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ
analyzed: abhijānāmi kho pana aham pitu sakkassa kammante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinnaḥ vivicca iva  kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham
translated: ‘I remember when, while my father the Sakyan was working, I was sitting in the cool shade of a rose-apple tree, secluded from sensual pleasures,

original: jhānaṁ upasampajja viharitā.
analyzed: jhānam upasampajja viharitā
translated: secluded from unwholesome things, and I entered and remained in the first jhāna, which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, with rapture and pleasure born of seclusion.

original: Siyā nu kho eso maggo bodhāyā’ti?
analyzed: siyā nu kho eso maggaḥ bodhāya ati
translated: Could this be the path to enlightenment?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhāradvāja, satānusāri viññāṇaṁ ahosi:
analyzed: tassa bhāradvāja sata anusāri viññāṇam ahosi
translated: Then, Bhāradvāja, my mind inclined to recollect my past lives.

original: ‘eseva maggo bodhāyā’ti.
analyzed: esa iva maggaḥ bodhāya ati
translated: ‘This is the path to enlightenment.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhāradvāja, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha bhāradvājaḥ
translated: Then, Bhāradvāja, I thought:

original: ‘kiṁ nu kho ahaṁ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yaṁ taṁ sukhaṁ aññatreva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī’ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho aham tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yam tam sukham aññatra iva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehi iti
translated: ‘Why should I be afraid of that happiness which is separate from sensual pleasures and unskillful qualities?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhāradvāja, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha bhāradvājaḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘na kho ahaṁ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yaṁ taṁ sukhaṁ aññatreva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī’ti.
analyzed: na kho aham tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yam tam sukham aññatra iva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehi iti
translated: ‘I’m not afraid of that happiness which is separate from sensual pleasures and unskillful qualities.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhāradvāja, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha bhāradvājaḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘na kho taṁ sukaraṁ sukhaṁ adhigantuṁ evaṁ adhimattakasimānaṁ pattakāyena.
analyzed: na khalu tam sukaram sukham adhigantum evam adhimattaka simānam patta kāyena
translated: ‘It’s not easy to attain that happiness with a body so excessively emaciated.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāreyyaṁ odanakummāsan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham oḷārikam āhāram āhāreyyam odana kummā asanti
translated: Why don’t I eat some solid food, such as boiled rice and porridge?’

original: So kho ahaṁ, bhāradvāja, oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāresiṁ odanakummāsaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha bhāradvājaḥ oḷārikam āhāram odana kummāsa
translated: So I ate some solid food.

original: Tena kho pana maṁ, bhāradvāja, samayena pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū paccupaṭṭhitā honti:
analyzed: tena kho pana ma bhāradvāja samayena pañcavaggiyāḥ bhikkhū paccupaṭṭhitāḥ honti
translated: At that time the group-of-five monks were attending on me, thinking,

original: ‘yaṁ kho samaṇo gotamo dhammaṁ adhigamissati taṁ no ārocessatī’ti.
analyzed: yam kho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dhammam adhigamissati tam naḥ ārocessati iti
translated: ‘Whatever the contemplative Gotama’s Dhamma will be, he will certainly inform us.’

original: Yato kho ahaṁ, bhāradvāja, oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāresiṁ odanakummāsaṁ, atha me te pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṁsu:
analyzed: yatas kho aha bhāradvājaḥ oḷārikam āhāram āhāresiṃ odana kummāsa atha me te pañcavaggiyāḥ bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamisu
translated: When I did so, the group of five monks left me, thinking:

original: ‘bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo padhānavibbhanto āvatto bāhullāyā’ti.🔽So kho ahaṁ, bhāradvāja, oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāretvā balaṁ gahetvā vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.🔽Vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ …
analyzed: bāhullikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ padhāna vibbhantaḥ āvattaḥ bāhullāya ati  saḥ kho aha bhāradvājaḥ oḷārikam āhāram āhāretvā balam gahetvā vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi  vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama has given up his striving and reverted to a life of luxury.’🔽“When I had eaten the boiled rice and porridge, I regained my strength. Then, secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, I entered and dwelled in the first jhāna, which consists of rapture and pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by directed thought and evaluation.🔽“With the stilling of directed thoughts and evaluations, I entered and dwelled in the second jhāna, which has internal placidity and unification of mind and consists of rapture and pleasure born of concentration, without directed thought and evaluation.

original: tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ …🔽catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: tatiyam jhānam  catuttham jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: “With the fading away as well of rapture, I dwelled equanimous and, mindful and clearly comprehending, I experienced pleasure with the body; I entered and dwelled in the third jhāna of which the noble ones declare: ‘He is equanimous, mindful, one who dwells happily.’🔽“With the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and displeasure, I entered and dwelled in the fourth jhāna, neither painful nor pleasant, which has purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi
translated: “When my concentrated mind was thus purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of recollecting my past lives.

original: So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi.
analyzed: saḥ aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ pe iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: I recollected my manifold past lives, that is, one birth, two … … thus with their aspects and particulars I recollected my manifold past lives.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, bhāradvāja, rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā,
analyzed: ayam kho me bhāradvāja rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the first knowledge I attained in the first watch of the night.

original: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno; yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.🔽So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato  saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi
translated: Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed; light arose — as happens in one who is heedful, ardent, and resolute.🔽“When my concentrated mind was thus purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.

original: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi …pe…
analyzed: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi pe
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate. I understood how beings pass on according to their actions thus: ‘These worthy beings who were ill-conducted in body, speech, and mind, revilers of noble ones, wrong in their views, giving effect to wrong view in their actions, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a state of deprivation, in a bad destination, in perdition, even in hell; but these worthy beings who were well-conducted in body, speech, and mind, not revilers of noble ones, right in their views, giving effect to right view in their actions, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a good destination, even in the heavenly world.’ Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and I understood how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: ayaṁ kho me, bhāradvāja, rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā
analyzed: ayam kho me bhāradvāja rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā
translated: This was the second knowledge I attained in the middle watch of the night. Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose;

original: vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno; yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: vijjā adhigatā avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: darkness was destroyed; light arose — as happens to one who is heedful, ardent, & resolute.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.🔽So ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ🔽abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī🔽paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ;
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi  so idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūta  abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī  paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam
translated: “When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilement, pliant, malleable, steady, & attained to imperturbability, I directed it to the knowledge of the ending of the effluents.🔽I discerned, as it had come to be, that ‘This is stress … This is the origination of stress … This is the cessation of stress … This is the way leading to the cessation of stress … These are effluents … This is the origination of effluents … This is the cessation of effluents … This is the way leading to the cessation of effluents …’

original: ‘ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ,
analyzed: ime āsavā ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: “I discerned, as it had come to be, that ‘These are the four noble truths.’

original: ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: ayam āsava nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati  yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew: ‘This is the path leading to the cessation of the effluents.’

original: Tassa me evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha.
analyzed: tassa me evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccittha bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccittha avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccittha
translated: When I knew and saw this, my mind was released from the effluent of sensuality, from the effluent of becoming, and from the effluent of ignorance.

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam ahosi
translated: When it was released, I knew it was released.

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: I directly knew: ‘Birth is ended, the holy life fulfilled, the task done. There is nothing further for this world.’”

original: Ayaṁ kho me, bhāradvāja, rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā
analyzed: ayam kho me bhāradvāja rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā
translated: This was the third knowledge I attained in the last watch of the night.

original: vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno; yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato”ti.
analyzed: vijjā adhigatā avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato ti
translated: Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed; light arose — as happens in one who is heedful, ardent, & resolute.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, saṅgāravo māṇavo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte saṅgāravaḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahman student Sangarava said to the Blessed One,

analyzed: aṭṭhitavatam bhoto gotamassa padhānam ahosi sappurisavatam bhoto gotamassa padhānam ahosi
translated: “The Blessed One’s striving was not in vain, his exertion was not fruitless.

original: yathā taṁ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: yathā tam arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: as is proper for one who is perfected and fully awakened.

original: Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, atthi devā”ti?
analyzed: kim nu khalu bho gotama atthi deva iti
translated: “Well then, Master Gotama, do the gods exist?”

analyzed: ṭhānasaḥ mā ita bhāradvāja viditam yat idam
translated: “Bhāradvāja, I know this to be the case:

analyzed: adhidevāti
translated: that there are gods higher than the gods.”

original: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘atthi devā’ti puṭṭho samāno ‘ṭhānaso metaṁ, bhāradvāja, viditaṁ yadidaṁ adhidevā’ti vadesi.
analyzed: kim nu kho bho gotama atthi deva ati puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ ṭhānasaḥ mā ita bhāradvāja viditam yat idam adhi deva ati vadesi
translated: “When asked if the gods exist, Master Gotama, why do you say that you know this to be the case that there are gods higher than the gods?

original: Nanu, bho gotama, evaṁ sante tucchā musā hotī”ti?
analyzed: nanu bho gotamaḥ evam sante tucchā musā hoti iti
translated: In that case, doesn’t what you say turn out to be empty and false?”

original: “‘Atthi devā’ti, bhāradvāja, puṭṭho samāno ‘atthi devā’ti yo vadeyya, ‘ṭhānaso me viditā’ti yo vadeyya;
analyzed: atthi deva iti bhāradvāja puṭṭho samānaḥ atthi deva iti yaḥ vadeyya ṭhānasaḥ me viditā ati yaḥ vadeyya
translated: “Bhāradvāja, when asked if the gods exist, if one were to say that the gods exist, one might say that one knows this to be the case.

analyzed: atha khvettha viññunā purisena ekasena niṭṭham gantabbam yat idam
translated: But a sensible person would come to a definite conclusion about this, namely that

analyzed: uccena sammatam kho eta bhāradvāja lokasmin yat idam
translated: “Bhāradvāja, it’s generally accepted in the world that

translated: When this was said, the student Saṅgārava said to the Buddha,

analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama  seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: “Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent!

analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti

analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the Dhamma, and to the Sangha of monks.

analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
